thread.title: Treasure trove of Apollo moon photos released
thread.title_full: Treasure trove of Apollo moon photos released

title: Treasure trove of Apollo moon photos released
text:
CNN Leadership
Treasure trove of Apollo moon photos released By Melonyce McAfee, CNN Updated 1240 GMT (1940 HKT) October 8, 2015 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions With Earth in the background, NASA astronaut David Scott works in space during the Apollo 9 mission in March 1969. More than 8,000 photos from NASA's Apollo missions were recently uploaded to Flickr. Here are a few from each mission. Hide Caption 1 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Astronaut Walter Cunningham aboard Apollo 7 in October 1968. Apollo 7 was the first manned Apollo flight. Hide Caption 2 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Apollo 7 was a test flight around Earth that laid the foundation for future trips to the moon. Hide Caption 3 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions The moon, as seen from Apollo 8 in December 1968. Apollo 8 orbited the moon and broadcast television images back to Earth. NASA used red and blue filters for the TV feed. Hide Caption 4 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Apollo 9 tested a lunar module above Earth to make sure it was ready to carry astronauts on a future trip to the moon. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Astronaut Russell Schweickart's feet are seen during one of Apollo 9's spaceflights. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Schweickart operates a 70-millimeter Hasselblad camera during the fourth day of Apollo 9's mission. Hide Caption 7 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions During Apollo 10, the lunar module was flown around the moon as a "dress rehearsal" for a later landing. Hide Caption 8 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Apollo 11 commander Neil Armstrong is photographed inside the lunar module after he and Buzz Aldrin walked on the moon's surface on July 20, 1969. Hide Caption 9 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Aldrin walks down the steps of the lunar module, codenamed "Eagle," as he prepares to walk on the moon. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions A close-up view of an astronaut's boot on the moon's surface during Apollo 11. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Apollo 12, in November 1969, also put astronauts on the lunar surface. Hide Caption 12 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Astronaut Alan Bean holds a sample of lunar soil during Apollo 12. Pete Conrad's reflection can be seen in Bean's visor as he takes the photo. Hide Caption 13 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions This shot of the moon's surface was taken aboard Apollo 13, which famously had to abort its landing and return to Earth after an explosion threatened the crew. Hide Caption 14 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Astronaut John Swigert, right, and the other two astronauts aboard Apollo 13 -- Fred Haise and Jim Lovell -- safely returned to Earth after improvising a solution to the craft's carbon-dioxide removal system. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions A close-up of the "mailbox" solution that saved the astronauts aboard Apollo 13. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Lovell sleeps in the lunar module of Apollo 13. Hide Caption 17 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Apollo 14 commander Alan Shepard poses next to the American flag while walking on the moon's surface in February 1971. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions David Scott rides a lunar rover during the Apollo 15 mission in July 1971. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Scott studies a boulder on the moon during Apollo 15. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions The lunar module from Apollo 15 is seen in orbit. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Apollo 16 commander John Young examines a boulder on the moon in April 1972. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Astronaut Charlie Duke tries to break a sample loose during Apollo 16. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions An astronaut works in space as Apollo 17 orbits the moon in December 1972. Hide Caption 24 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Apollo 17 was the last of the Apollo missions. Humans have not been to the moon since. Hide Caption 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions An astronaut rides on a lunar module during Apollo 17. Hide Caption 26 of 27 27 photos: Photos from NASA's Apollo missions Astronaut Harrison Schmitt is photographed next to the American flag while walking on the moon during Apollo 17. Hide Caption
